HomePage.title: Welcome to RestQL App by Unit team

description.title: Project introduction
description.text: Hello! We, the 'Unit' team, are pleased to present to you the RestQL App application. Our product, combining the functionality of Postman and GraphiQL in one interface, allows users to make requests to RESTfull and GraphQL APIs, providing a convenient tool for interacting with any open API. We approached the development of the application with great attention and responsibility. Each of the participants made their invaluable contribution to our brainchild, which we are proud of and hope that you will also find it useful and valuable. Before starting to use the application, please read the information below. This will allow you to use RestQL without errors and without any difficulties. Thank you for your attention and enjoy using, dear friend!
description.listSubtitle: Ready to start? Then follow these steps:
list: If you are not yet authorized, please register or log in.
To get started, select one of the sections: REST API, GraphiQL
Make sure you are using the correct URls, endpoints, and request methods.

title: RESTFull client
GraphiQL client
Request history
text: To work with the REST API, follow the link of the same name. Enter the URL, select the request method, add headers and request body. Then click the 'Send' button.
To start working with graphiQL clients, also use the necessary navigation link. Enter the URL, select the request method, add headers and request body. Then click the 'Send' button.

In the 'History' section, you can view the history of requests that you sent. To do this, follow the appropriate link in the navigation. The history displays all the requests you sent, including the URL, request method, headers, and request body. You can view the details of the request, as well as repeat it.

Form.password-spec-char: Must be at least 1 special character (!@#$%^&*)
